monogr.author: Thomas of Hales

monogr.title: The Owl and the Nightingale and the English Poems of Oxford, Jesus College, MS 29 (II)

projectDesc.p: The Middle English Texts Series offers a diverse and representative array of literary texts that medieval readers in the present-day British Isles would have encountered between the twelfth and sixteenth centuries. It is committed to making available both affordable print and open access editions to scholars, teachers, and students of the Western Middle Ages. In its digital publications, the series prioritizes a user-friendly interface and viewing options, multiple downloadable formats, enhanced searchability and filtering, and accessibility to the widest possible range of users.

editorialDecl.p: METS takes as its mission the creation of affordable editions that would pass scrutiny from the most demanding expert, yet would prove comprehensible, and even enticing, to someone who had never read Middle English before. This agenda dictates that METS publications offer not a critical edition reflecting all surviving manuscripts, and certainly not a diplomatic edition, but a best-text edition, informed by the notes and apparatus of earlier editions (where these exist), and by substantive variants from other manuscript witnesses. Transcriptions of Middle English texts are lightly modernized to ensure a smooth reading experience, while non-English texts preserve both the original language and a modern English translation in facing-page format. Each edition offers expert assistance with language and lexicon, providing glosses alongside the text(s), textual and explanatory notes, elucidation of unfamiliar contexts and traditions, and thematic and interpretive possibilities. All editions feature general introductions that set the edited text within its own time, place, and traditions, and link it to ancestor, congener, and successor materials. All publications contain comprehensive, current bibliographies of pertinent scholarship and criticism. House style is adapted from the Chicago Manual of Style.

correction.p: This text may include corrections made after the original edition went to press in order to correct errors and improve glosses. For a full list of editorial and typographical corrections made to this edition, please view its correction log on Github: https://github.com/mets-editions/fein-owl/blob/main/fein-owl-export-corrections-log.docx

div.note: incipitIncipiunt documenta regis Alvredi. MS: Written in red ink.
1At. MS: Begins with blue capital A, two lines high, with red flourishes.
Sevorde. MS: Śeuorde. Wright-Halliwell: Sévorde. Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall, Treharne: Seuorde.
sete. So Hall, Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström: séte.
2bok-ilered. So Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall: bok-iléred.
7durlyng. So MS, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall. Wright-Halliwell: derlyng. Treharne: durlynge.
8Englene londe. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Hall, Borgström, Treharne. Skeat: Engle-londe.
9lere. So Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall: lére.
11Hw. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall. Treharne: How.
12Englene lond. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: Engle-lond.
13And. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall. Treharne: An.
14clerek. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: clerk.
1–18At Sevorde . . . Englelonde on. MS: Written as prose on nine lines.
19Thus. MS: Begins with red capital Þ, one line high.
20eure. So Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall: éure.
21ou. So Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall: óu.
22Hw. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall. Treharne: How.
wrthsipes. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall. Skeat: wurþshipes. Treharne: Wurþsipes.
19–24Thus queth Alvred . . . the King Alvred. MS: Written as prose on four lines.
25Mildeliche. MS: Begins with red capital M, one line high.
Paragraph break. So MS, Wright-Halliwell. Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall, Treharne: No paragraph break.
27adrede. So Morris, Skeat, Hall, Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Borgström: adréde.
36The. So Hall. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris: We. Skeat: hwo. Borgström, Treharne: Wo. Morris suggests Þe due to a scribe reading Þ as Ƿ.
wrthie. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall. Skeat, Treharne: wurþie.
25–36Mildeliche ich munye . . . wrthie thencheth. MS: Written as prose on seven lines.
37Thus. MS: Begins with blue capital Þ, one line high.
38under. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: ben under. Borgström: beo vnder.
40wyttes. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: writes. Borgström: wrytes.
42Hw. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall. Treharne: How.
37–43Thus queth Alvred . . . Thus queth Alvred. MS: Written as prose on four lines.
44The1. MS: Begins with red capital Þ, one line high.
the2. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall. Treharne: he.
45godne. So Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall: gódne.
48clerek. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: clerk.
49He schulle. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: schulle.
demen. So Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall: démen.
evelyche. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: evenlyche.
51Demen. So Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall: démen. Skeat: hi schulle démen.
55kenliche. So MS (henliche, h1 corrected to k), Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall, Treharne.
fone. So Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall: fóne.
57Chireche. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: chirche.
44–63The eorl . . . hit wel fare. MS: Written as prose on ten lines.

55–63Than knyhte . . . hit wel fare. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Borgström, Treharne (no paragraph break). Morris: Space added for a new section. Skeat, Hall: Space added for a new section with line inserted: Þus queþ Alured.
64Thus. MS: Begins with blue capital Þ, one line high.
67lortheu. So MS, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Wright-Halliwell: lorthen.
68one. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: on.
73wene. So Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall: wéne.
64–76Thus queth Alvred . . . Thus queth Alvred. MS: Written as prose on seven lines.
77Wythute. MS: wythute (lacks colored capital).
82frumthe. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: fremde.
iwrche. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall. Skeat, Treharne: iwurche.

77–85Wythute wysdome . . . Thus queth Alvred. MS: Written as prose on six lines, without any break between lines 76 and 77. Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall, Treharne: paragraph break. Wright-Halliwell: no paragraph break.
86Ne. MS: Begins with red capital N, one line high.
89–90thenne he wule, / God after uvele, weole after wowe. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Treharne. Hall: god after vuele. / weole after wowe. þenne he wule.
91Wel is him that hit ischapen is. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: wel him þat ischapen is.
86–92Ne scholde never . . . Thus seyth Alvred. MS: Written as prose on four lines.
93Strong. MS: Begins with blue capital S, one line high.
reowe. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: rowe.
see. So Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall: séé.
95the2. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall. Treharne: þat.
swo. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: yeorne swo.
93–102Strong hit is . . . Thus queth Alvred. MS: Written as prose on six lines.
103Mony. MS: Begins with red capital M, one line high.
104the. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: þat.
105his. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: he his.
lyves. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall. Treharne: lyf.
106leten. So Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall: léten.

vexynde. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: wexynde.
112Hwanne. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Treharne. Skeat, Hall: Hwanne we.
103–13Mony mon weneth . . . Thus queth Alvred. MS: Written as prose on eight lines.
114Yf. MS: Begins with red capital Y, one line high.
115upen. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: vpon.
nywrthe. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall. Skeat, Treharne: ny-wurþe.
116istreon. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall. Treharne: istreone.
117hit. So MS, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Wright-Halliwell: it.
119vouh. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Hall, Treharne. Skeat, Borgström: veoh.
120maythenes. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Hall, Treharne. Skeat, Borgström: madmes.
114–21Yf thu seolver . . . Thus queth Alvred. MS: Written as prose on six lines.
122Ne. MS: Begins with red capital N, one line high.
see. So Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall: séé.
124gnyde. So MS, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Wright-Halliwell: guyde.
128forleseth. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall. Treharne: forleoseþ.
129nere. So Treharne, Skeat. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall: nére.
122–30Ne ilef thu nouht to fele . . . Thus queth Alvred. MS: Written as prose on six lines.
131Lusteth. MS: Begins with red capital L, one line high.
me. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: mi.
133lere. So Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall: lére.
134the. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall. Treharne: he.
139wile. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: hwile.
131–40Lusteth ye . . . Thus queth Alvred. MS: Written as prose on six lines.
141If. MS: Begins with blue capital I, one line high.
142hit nouht. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: hit.
144lyke. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: þe lyke.
148swyhc. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Hall, Treharne. Skeat, Borgström: swych.
149the. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall. Skeat: hit þe. Treharne: he.
141–56If thu havest seorewe . . . Thus queth Alvred. MS: Written as prose on eight lines.
157Ne. MS: Begins with red capital N, one line high.
158none. So Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall: nóne.
166uppen. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: vppon.
157–72Ne schaltu nevere . . . Thus queth Alvred. MS: Written as prose on eight lines.
173Ne.1 MS: Begins with blue capital Þ, one line high.
174evere. So Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall: éuere.
175thu. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: heo.
179word-woth. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Hall. Skeat, Borgström, Treharne: word-wod.
173–81Ne wurth thu never so wod . . . Thus queth Alfred. MS: Written as prose on seven lines. 182–205Idelschipe and overprute . . . Thus queth Alvred. MS: Written as prose on twelve lines.

183wolde. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: heo wolde.
187aswote. So Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall: a swóte.

253god. So Treharne. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall: gód.
254chyreche. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: chyrche.
259londe. So Treharne, Skeat. MS, Morris, Borgström, Hall: lond le. Wright-Hall: lond be.
243–60Thurh sawe . . . Thus queth Alvred. MS: Written as prose on ten lines.
261Alle. MS: Begins with red capital A, one line high.
273wrthie. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall. Skeat, Treharne: wurþie.
274Salomon. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: Salomon Salomon.
261–79Alle world-ayhte . . . Thus queth Alvred. MS: Written as prose on twelve lines.
280Ne1. MS: Begins with blue capital N, one line high.
284ne bigynne. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Skeat: bi-gynne.
290iscohte. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Hall, Treharne. Skeat, Borgström: i-schote.
280–96Ne gabbe thu . . . Thus queth Alvred. MS: Written as prose on eight lines.
296Alvred. So MS, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Wright-Halliwell: Alvered.
297Wis. MS: Begins with red capital W, one line high.
304wexende. So Skeat. MS, Wright-Halliwell, Hall: werende. Morris, Borgström, Treharne: wexynde.
310unyqueme. So MS, Wright-Halliwell, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall. Treharne: unqueme.
317arixlye. So MS, Morris, Skeat, Borgström, Hall, Treharne. Wright-Halliwell: arulye.
297–318Wis child is . . . Amen. Expliciunt dicta regis Alvredi. MS: Written as prose on eleven lines.
